paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant V1221, including clinical significance, penetrance data, and individual records.

patients.phenotype: cardiomyopathy, sinus node dysfunction, and peripheral neuropathy

individual_records.phenotype_details: cardiomyopathy, sinus node dysfunction, and peripheral neuropathy
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The TTR V122I variant — a variant present in 3%–4% of Black individuals — was associated with cardiomyopathy, sinus node dysfunction, and peripheral neuropathy in our PheWAS.

functional_data.summary: The TTR V122I variant is associated with hereditary TTR cardiac amyloidosis.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is associated with multiple phenotypes including glaucoma.
key_quotes: The TTR V122I variant — a variant present in 3%–4% of Black individuals — was associated with cardiomyopathy, sinus node dysfunction, and peripheral neuropathy in our PheWAS.
Surprisingly, we found an association of the V122I TTR pQTL with primary angle closure glaucoma.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for the TTR variant was extracted successfully.
